name: XbmcControllerJs
tagline: JavaScript library that makes it easy to talk to XBMC via the JSON API using Websockets, with a fallback to the HTTP API.
body:
### Status / Version
Pre-alpha

### Components
XbmcControllerJs consists of 3 main components:

* Xbmc.Controller
* Xbmc.CachedQueries
* Xbmc.WebSocketsApi / Xbmc.HttpApi (only volume notification can be subscribed to)

Typically you will only need to use Xbmc/Controller, but it is possible to communicate with Xbmc.CachedQueries, Xbmc.WebSocketsApi or Xbmc.HttpApi directly.

Xbmc.Controller will attempt to use Web Sockets first. Web sockets allows for 2-way communications, so notifications for events will be instantaneous. In addition, Web Sockets supports will work cross domain requests - No more CORS errors! All major browsers now support Web Sockets. Even IE (since v10). See - http://caniuse.com/websockets

HTTP API has to poll, so notifications will be delayed and have a higher overhead. In addition, each item needs to be individually polled for, and thus specifically implemented. As such, the HTTP API only supports a small set of notifications.

#### Xbmc.Controller (first upload pending)

Usage:

```
var xbmc = new Xbmc.Controller(); // automatically determines websockets or http
xbmc.setMute(true); // helper command
xbmc.Application.SetMute({mute:true}); // any RPC command can be run under the controller class
```

#### Xbmc.WebSocketsApi & Xbmc.HttpApi

Both classes follow the same interface. The only difference between the two is the notifications that can be subscribed to.

Usage:

```
var xbmcWs = new Xbmc.WebSockets({hostname:'192.168.0.10'}); // <-- XBMC IP or Hostname
xbmcWs.subscribe('Application.OnVolumeChanged',onVolChanged);
xbmcWs.call('Application.SetMute',{mute:true}); // <-- will cause onVolChanged to be called
xbmcWs.unsubscribe('Application.OnVolumeChanged',onVolChanged);

function onVolChanged(response) {
    console.log('New volume is '+reponse.volume);
    console.log('New mute is '+response.muted);
}
```

### Authors and Contributors
Written by Den Williams (@denwilliams)

With a couple of snippets taken from the following projects:
* https://github.com/bailus/XBMC-Simple-Remote - by @bailus
* https://github.com/lucifurious/jquery-xbmc - by @lucifurious
